q: Which sentence is in the second conditional?
options: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
If I was rich, I travel the world.
If I were rich, I travel the world.
If I will be rich, I would travel the world.

q: Which sentence uses the Present Continuous correctly?
options: He has worked at the moment.
He is working at the moment.
He work at the moment.
He worked at the moment.

q: Which sentence is in the present simple tense?
options: They were playing basketball yesterday.
She is singing a song right now.
I eat breakfast every morning.
He will finish his work by 5 PM.

q: Which modal verb is used to give advice?
options: Must
Might
Should
Can

q: What tense is used to describe actions that happened at a specific time in the past?
options: Present tense
Past tense
Future tense
Present perfect tense

q: What is the correct question tag for 'She is tired'?
options: Hasn’t she?
Doesn’t she?
Isn’t she?
Didn’t she?

q: Which sentence correctly uses a gerund?
options: I enjoy to swim.
I enjoy swim.
I enjoy swimming.
I enjoy to swimming.

q: Which sentence is in the past simple?
options: She finished her homework.
She is finishing her homework.
She has finished her homework.
She finishes her homework.

q: What is the correct form of the Present Simple for the sentence: "She ___ (to work) every day."
options: working
works
worked
has worked

q: have visited Paris many times," what tense is "have visited"?
options: Future tense
Present perfect tense
Past tense
Present tense

q: Which sentence uses reported speech correctly?
options: I told him that he could leave early.
He said: "I will go to the party."
They asked where was the nearest bus stop.
She said: "He is studying for his exam."

q: Which option correctly changes "I am going to the party" into reported speech?
options: He said that he went to the party.
He said that he goes to the party.
He said that he was going to the party.
He said that he is going to the party.

q: What is the reported form of "I will visit my grandparents next week"?
options: He said that he will visit his grandparents next week.
He said that he would visit his grandparents the following week.
He said that he would visit his grandparents next week.
He said that he would visit my grandparents next the following week.

q: What is the reported speech of "I have finished my homework"?
options: He said that he finishes his homework.
He said that he had finished his homework.
He said that he is finished his homework.
He said that he finish his homework.

q: When do we use a relative clause?
options: To give orders
To express wishes
To ask questions
To provide additional information about a noun

q: What is the purpose of a relative pronoun?
options: To indicate possession
To connect a dependent clause to its antecedent
To express a command
To link a verb to a subject

q: What is the reporting counterpart of "what time is it"?
options: She asked what time it was?
she asked what time is it
she asked what time it is
She asked what time it was

q: Which sentence contains a correct relative clause?
options: The man who is wearing a blue hat.
The woman bought some apples yesterday.
That book he read it last night.
She doesn’t know what is he doing.

q: What is the purpose of reported speech?
options: To report the weather
To retell what someone else said
To tell a story about what someone said
To quote what someone said

q: Which sentence correctly uses a relative pronoun?
options: He is the one what finished first in the race.
The car who is parked outside is mine.
The girl that is reading a book is my sister.
This is the house whom we lived in last year.

q: Which of the following is the correct WH-question for asking about frequency?
options: Why does she visit her parents?
What time does she arrive?
How often does she visit her parents?
Where does she usually go?

q: Choose the correct yes/no question to inquire about someone’s experience:
options: Have you never been to Paris?
Did you ever been to Paris?
Have you ever been to Paris?
You never go to Paris, don’t you?

q: Which of these sentences is a tag question used to seek agreement?
options: He can swim, isn’t he?
They will attend, isn’t it?
You're coming with us, aren’t you?
She sings beautifully, does she?

q: Choose the correct yes/no question
options: you know what time it is?
Do you know what time is it?
Have you known what time it is?
Do you know what time it is?

q: Choose the correct form of a yes/no question to confirm a completed action:
options: Is you finished your homework?
Did you finish your homework?
Has you finished your homework?
Are you finished your homework?

q: Identify the correct WH-question to ask about the manner of doing something:
options: How does she manage her time so well?
Where does she work?
What is she doing right now?
Why is she late?

q: Which sentence is a tag question that checks for confirmation?
options: He isn’t coming, isn’t he?
You don’t know him, do you?
They aren’t ready, are they?
She’s your friend, is she?

q: Identify the correct WH-question to inquire about future plans:
options: Where did you go last week?
How long have you been here?
What will you be doing tomorrow?
Why are you studying English?

q: Identify the correct WH-question for asking about someone’s preferences:
options: What do you like to do in your free time?
What did you do last weekend?
Where did you go last weekend?
How many times have you travelled by plane?

q: Which sentence is a tag question used to express surprise?
options: They are going, are they?
She didn’t call you, didn’t she?
He won’t be there, will they?
You aren’t leaving already, are you?
